meta.description: Family members, common foods, everyday objects, and telling time in Italian.

module.name: Daily Life
module.description: Learn vocabulary for family, food, everyday objects, and time expressions.

lessons.title: Family and Daily Words
lessons.description: Learn essential vocabulary for family members, common foods, and household items.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'mother' in Italian?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Madre' is mother. 'Mamma' is mom (informal).

quiz_questions.question: What does 'fratello' mean?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Fratello' means brother. 'Sorella' is sister.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'water' in Italian?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Acqua' means water. It's feminine: l'acqua.

quiz_questions.question: What is 'pane' in English?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Pane' means bread in Italian.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'table' in Italian?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Tavolo' means table. It's masculine: il tavolo.

lessons.title: Possessives and Avere/Essere
lessons.description: Learn possessive adjectives and master avere (to have) and essere (to be).

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'my mother' in Italian?
quiz_questions.explanation: Family members usually don't take the article: 'mia madre'.

quiz_questions.question: 'Ho due fratelli' means:
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Ho' = I have (avere). 'Due fratelli' = two brothers.

quiz_questions.question: Which is correct for 'my house'?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'La mia casa' - non-family nouns need the article.

quiz_questions.question: Complete: 'Noi ___ italiani' (We are Italian)
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Siamo' is the noi form of essere (to be).

quiz_questions.question: Complete: 'Loro ___ fame' (They are hungry)
quiz_questions.explanation: In Italian, you 'have' hunger: 'avere fame'. Loro hanno fame.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'our house'?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'La nostra casa' - 'nostra' means 'our' for feminine nouns.

quiz_questions.question: 'Lei è medico' means:
quiz_questions.explanation: 'È' (essere) + profession. Articles often omitted with professions.

quiz_questions.question: Which expression uses 'avere' (to have)?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Ho fame' (I have hunger) - Italian uses 'avere' for hunger, thirst, age.

lessons.title: Family Conversations
lessons.description: Practice talking about your family and daily routines.

flashcards.back: Che ora è? / Che ore sono?

quiz_questions.question: How do you ask 'Do you have siblings?' informally?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Hai fratelli o sorelle?' uses 'avere' (to have).

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'I live with my family'?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Abito con la mia famiglia' - 'abitare' means to live.

quiz_questions.question: What does 'Che ore sono?' mean?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Che ore sono?' and 'Che ora è?' both ask for the time.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'It's 3 o'clock'?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Sono le tre' - use 'sono' for 2+ o'clock, 'è' for 1 o'clock.

quiz_questions.question: How do you respond to 'Quanti fratelli hai?'
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Ho tre fratelli' answers how many brothers you have.

lessons.title: Reading About Daily Life
lessons.description: Read and understand texts about family and daily routines.

quiz_questions.question: Read: 'La mia famiglia è grande. Ho tre fratelli.' How many brothers?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Tre fratelli' means three brothers.

quiz_questions.question: Read: 'Faccio colazione alle otto.' When does the person eat breakfast?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Alle otto' means at eight o'clock.

quiz_questions.question: Read: 'Mia madre cucina tutti i giorni.' What does the mother do?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Cucina' means 'she cooks'. 'Cucinare' = to cook.

quiz_questions.question: Read: 'Abitiamo in una casa piccola ma accogliente.' The house is:
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Piccola ma accogliente' = small but welcoming/cozy.

quiz_questions.question: Read: 'La domenica pranziamo con i nonni.' When do they lunch with grandparents?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'La domenica' means on Sunday/Sundays.

lessons.title: Days and Time Expressions
lessons.description: Learn to understand days of the week and time expressions.

quiz_questions.question: Which day sounds like 'loo-neh-DEE'?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Lunedì' (Monday) is pronounced 'loo-neh-DEE'.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'Saturday' in Italian?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Sabato' is Saturday. 'Domenica' is Sunday.

quiz_questions.question: Italian days of the week are:
quiz_questions.explanation: Unlike English, Italian days are not capitalized.

quiz_questions.question: What does 'il fine settimana' mean?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Il fine settimana' literally means 'the end of the week' = weekend.

quiz_questions.question: Which day sounds like 'mehr-ko-leh-DEE'?
quiz_questions.explanation: 'Mercoledì' (Wednesday) is pronounced 'mehr-ko-leh-DEE'.
